subject: RE: [junit] Best practice - should I fake, or depend on real worl	d objects?
msgSnippet: ... uses ... that ... Not so much pain yet as worry.  In the context of my current application I don t think there would (ever?) be much pain in this process -
messageBody:
JB wrote:

> > So
> > when I come to use them during testing (because the method under test
uses
> > them) I have a decision to make - should I (1) fake; (2) use the
> > deserialisation process to construct a "real" object; or (3) add a
> > constructor that takes 20+ parameters and construct my in memory object
that
> > way.

> #3, beyond question. If #3 is very slow, then consider extracting an
> interface and doing #1. Do not do #2, since that is testing two things
> at once, and that will make you feel pain. (And here you are.)

Not so much pain yet as worry. In the context of my current application I
don't think there would (ever?) be much pain in this process - because these
objects (in the production code) can not come into existence any other way,
consequently their serialisation/deserialisation code is one of the first
things to be tested and is executed pretty thoroughly. However in other
projects...

Thank you.
